net.hudup.core.data

Class DataDriverList

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.hudup.core.data.DataDriverList

  • public final class DataDriverList
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains a list of DataDriver and provides utility method on processing such list such as adding new data driver and finding a data driver. Note, DataDriver is the final class representing specific data types such as system file or database. Each data driver has a data type and is always associated a driver class. For example, MySQL database is associated with the driver class "com.mysql.jdbc.Driver".
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen

      DataDriverList()

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(DataDriver driver)
      Adding a specified data driver into this list.
      void clear()
      Clearing this list, which means that all data drivers are removed from this list.
      int findDriver(DataDriver.DataType driverType)
      Finding the data driver having the specified type.
      int findDriverByInnerClass(java.lang.String innerClassName)
      Finding the data driver having the specified class name.
      int findDriverByName(java.lang.String driverName)
      Finding the data driver having the specified name.
      DataDriver get(int index)
      Getting the data driver at specified index.
      static DataDriverList list()
      Retrieving global data driver list.
      void loadDefault()
      Loading default data driver list including data drivers such as Derby, Derby engine, file system, FTP file system, HTTP file system, Hudup RMI, Hudup socket, Microsoft SQL Sever database, MySQL database, Oracle database, PostgreSQL database.
      int size()
      Getting the size of this driver list.

      • size

        Getting the size of this driver list.

      • get

        public DataDriver get(int index)
        Getting the data driver at specified index.
        Parameters:
        index - specified index.
        Returns:
        DataDriver at specified index.

      • findDriverByInnerClass

        public int findDriverByInnerClass(java.lang.String innerClassName)
        Finding the data driver having the specified class name. For example, the data driver for Derby engine database has class name "org.apache.derby.jdbc.EmbeddedDriver".
        Parameters:
        innerClassName - specified class name.
        Returns:
        index of driver in list. The method returns -1 if no driver is found.

      • findDriverByName

        public int findDriverByName(java.lang.String driverName)
        Finding the data driver having the specified name. For example, the data driver for Derby engine database has class name "derby".
        Parameters:
        driverName - specified name.
        Returns:
        index of driver in list. The method returns -1 if no driver is found.

      • findDriver

        public int findDriver(DataDriver.DataType driverType)
        Finding the data driver having the specified type. For example, the data driver for Derby engine database has DataDriver.DataType.derby_engine.
        Parameters:
        driverType - specified DataDriver.DataType.
        Returns:
        index of driver in list having the specified type.

      • add

        public void add(DataDriver driver)
        Adding a specified data driver into this list.
        Parameters:
        driver - specified data driver.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clearing this list, which means that all data drivers are removed from this list.

      • loadDefault

        public void loadDefault()
        Loading default data driver list including data drivers such as Derby, Derby engine, file system, FTP file system, HTTP file system, Hudup RMI, Hudup socket, Microsoft SQL Sever database, MySQL database, Oracle database, PostgreSQL database.

      • list

        public static DataDriverList list()
        Retrieving global data driver list.
        Returns:
        global data driver list dataDriverList.
